name: Cave B Inn & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Here's what you need to know about Cave B. The location is remote - which is a positive if you are looking for peace and quiet in a naturally spectacular area. The accommodations are very clean, spacious and modern. The property is unusual as it is covered with gardens. The staff seem quite friendly. Be aware that if you book a Cavern room, you'll have to park your vehicle in a field up the hill from your room. Very happy with this unique hotel.
reviews.title: Peaceful accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cave B at Sagecliffs is a beautiful location above the Columbia River near Quincy and right next to "The Gorge at George" Amphitheater. We stayed at the Cliff House #9, a large room and wonderful accommodations with doors from both the Bedroom and the Living Room to the Patio where you can lounge on the Patio Chairs and sip your favorite wine. The Living Room and Bedroom is separated by a see-through Fireplace with the TV perched on the Mantle above it. The TV can be rotated to be seen from either the Living Room or The Bedroom. The Living Room also has a table and chair where the phone is and a place to put your computer. There is also a small refrigerator, a coffee pot and tea pot. There is a flagstone stairway to each Cliff House and adequate parking close by. The Pool is within walking distance and very relaxing since it is Saltwater rather that Chlorine purified. The Wine tasting room is a short drive near the top of the property and there is a good selection of wine.
reviews.title: The Gorge at George

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Price is the rub. If we had not been given a Gift Certificate by our Daughter and Son-in-Law, we certainly would not have stayed there because the rates seemed very high to us ($289-$389 per night). There is a very good restaurant in the Main Lodge Building but since you are a captive audience and there is not an alternative within a reasonable distance, the prices are extremely high. A couple can expect to pay $100-$150 for Dinner and the Menu doesn't give you very many desirable choices. The Tuna and Halibut were very good with an undesirable choice of vegetables and no salad. What they called Strip Steak was neither a New York Strip nor Steak that could be identified. It was tender and cooked properly but there was a sever lack of seasoning. Again, the choice of vegetables was lacking also with no salad.
reviews.title: Serenity Off the Beaten Path

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: They did provide a complimentary Continental Breakfast that was about maybe a tenth the selection as Holiday Inn. Breakfast could also be ordered from the menu but price was an issue. Sunday Brunch was served at 10 AM but since we had to check out by 12 o'clock and the price was extravagant, we checked out and had a bite to eat on the way home.
reviews.title: A gem in the desert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: If price is not an issue for you then Cave B is a beautiful place and you can have a good time.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just came back from 2 nights spent on a yurt. We wanted a pretty, quiet place to relax and that is exactly what we got. We were warmly greeted and informed that we had the "best room in the house". That would be yurt #16, which is the furthest away from the rest of the camp, but closest to the vineyards.
reviews.title: Quite unique; understand your "neighbors"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Understand that the yurts are relatively in the "wilderness"; no fences, no one around, really. No phone to get anything from reception. The yurts are luxury camping. This wilderness meant that while we sipped wine sitting on the wooden platform in front of the yurt's door, a deer said hi from no more than 60 feet, while she munched a couple vine leaves. Quite a beautiful moment. We saw rabbits running and prairie dogs hiding in earth mounds, just sitting there without making noises.
reviews.title: Disconnected but enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the other hand, there are going to be a couple little spiders here and there, and we had a tiny frog appearing over the shower rod at night (how it got that high, I have no idea). The second night we were reading in bed with the light on, and the yurt has a skylight on top. It looks like our light may have illuminated an insect sticked to the inside of the skylight, attracting by surprise a huge owl that tried to grab it. Imagine me looking up and just seeing 2 big owl talons and those huge yellow owl eyes in the middle of the skylight! Obviously after a couple tries the owl flew away. There is no way any animal larger that an ant can enter the yurt with the door shut, but again, you are in the wild... If it's windy, the yurt canvas wobbles and it is a bit noisy, I love the feeling but people better be used to it, or expecting it.
reviews.title: Great views; A Yurt Adventure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "Real" neighbors from other yurts can be easily heard as well, but we were lucky. Just a few laugh from a wedding celebration far in the wine tasting building.
reviews.title: Quiet and Refreshing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To keep it short, the swimming pool is great, the hiking is great, Sunday brunch is tasty, local sourced and great value; We found dinner OK but a bit overpriced. Service was very good everty time. There aren't many alternative dining options around, unless you like tacos/traditional Mexican. The sizable Mexican community in nearby Quincy, a 15min drive NE, has brought a couple awesome family restaurants, specially "Tacos de mi pueblo". Zero fancy, top marks for authentic food. Great hosts.
reviews.title: Quiet Low Keyed Get Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were lucky enough to stay at Cave B via a Living Social Deal which was awesome. We stayed in a Cliffehouse which was very very nice. The view amazing. Since we were driving all that way (5 hours), we wanted to stay a 2nd night and booked a yurt (because it was cheaper and we thought it would be fun), but then decided to pay for a 2nd night in the Cliffehouse instead and we are so glad we did. The yurts although nicely done, would have been a huge letdown after the Cliffehouse. We did not drive 5 hours for a camping experience w/out the campfire. We also checked out the Cavern Rooms while there, and they are nice as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Living social deal gave us $100 off dinner which was good because I would say the restaurant was overpriced and the food was upscale but not the best I've ever had. The wine was a good deal and decent. The dessert we had was okay, had potential to be exceptional by the description, but was not.
reviews.title: Great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The waitestaff was excellent.
reviews.title: Awesome Views, Bad Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Relaxing with great views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a Pedicure, cost was $65 (but fortunately mine was discounted from the LS deal).
reviews.title: Tranquility in the desert!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views are amazing! The Cavern rooms are not! Cobwebs on the tv stand, many glass rings on the table, the ac was broken and ants in the bathroom. The patio was overgrown with weeds and the general landscaping looked as if it hadn't been touched in months. We had dinner at Tendrils for our anniversary celebration. The dinner was fabulous, I had the grilled scallops and my husband had a steak. We had told them it was our anniversary when we booked (because they asked if it was a special celebration) but no mention of it or a special dessert like many upscale places do. The next day we asked for a new room and asked for a Cliffside House. Much better room, but the property is worn out. We had a couples massage, it was amazing! The shower after was great with five sprays. The wine tasting was fun. We had bought snacks earlier and bought a bottle of wine from the tasting room to enjoy on the patio of our room. If you go only stay at the Cliffside houses, they are private and have spectacular views from your bed and sitting area.
reviews.title: Anniversary Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cave B Inn is perfect for an over night get-away. We stayed in the Cliff House and I really recommend this. Large space, private patio, gas fireplace if needed and great views. Have dinner at the restaurant and sip wine at the attached winery. Not much else around the immediate area so you will want to spend you time at the Inn relaxing and enjoying the views.
reviews.title: Nice and relaxing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about Cave B was its views. We checked in at noon, but since our room wasnt ready yet, we did the wine tasting while waiting. $7 per person for 10 sips of their reds and whites. I enjoyed almost every wine we tried. We also decided to have a snack after the tasting. The tasting room sells wedges of cheese for $3...we got a gorgonzola and dubliner. We enjoyed it with a bottle of red we purchased. Great way to start off our weekend getaway.
reviews.title: Overpriced Resort with Gorgeous Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a cliffhouse (#13). I asked the front desk staff about their wifi - its advertised as free. She says it's available in our cliffhouse, however my iPhone and iPad couldn't find any signal. I call front desk from our room and they told me to unplug the phone and search for the signal again...still nothing. Oh well.
reviews.title: Unique and beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cliffhouse is amazing! Along with the views, it has a great bed, a tub, a shower, and living room area. Everything in the room was great, except for the multiple dark stains on the leather sofa.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel and Staff

description: Cave B Inn & Spa offers breathtaking views of our own estate vineyards, the Columbia River and the state's most dramatic gorge location. Cave B Inn offers 55 guestrooms, including 15 stand-alone Cliffehouses, 12 Cavern Rooms, three Inn Suites, and 25 Desert Yurts, as well as Tendrils Restaurant, The Spa at Cave B Inn, award-winning Cave B Estate Winery, and a dramatic cliffside outdoor swimming pool. Come for a weekend, a true Washington State vacation, for a romantic getaway, or for a concert next door at the Gorge Amphitheater. Experience outdoor adventure, one of the few estate wineries in Washington State, and a landscape like no other at one of the Northwest's finest resorts.
